adjectives.description: inconsistent (comparative more inconsistent, superlative most inconsistent)

entries.meaning: Not compatible (with another thing); incompatible, discrepant, at odds.
examples: His account of the evening was inconsistent with the security-camera footage.

entries.meaning: Lacking internal consistency; self-contradicting; not compatible with itself.
examples: He gave an inconsistent account of the evening, saying he called her before eight, but later that he had not talked to her until after nine.

entries.meaning: Not consistent or coherent in thought or behavior.
examples: “Take him for better or worse,” added Mr. Lee, “and I think he is the strangest and most inconsistent man I ever saw.”
“Inconsistent!” resumed Mr. Jones. “He is worse than inconsistent. Inconsistencies may be pardoned as constitutional defects [...]”

entries.meaning: (logic) Having the property that a contradiction can be derived.
